title: language_test2_03
prompt:
What is the best way to complete blank 3?

![dropdown:Drop_Down_551_61] lasted almost a month.
feedback: The correct answer is “The Democrats’ filibuster.” The sentence should read: “The Democrats’ filibuster lasted almost a month.” Earlier in the passage, it states: “Senators from the minority Democratic Party opposed it and started a filibuster to prevent a vote.” This makes it clear that more than one Democrat started the filibuster. Therefore, “Democrats’” should be plural possessive, describing the filibuster of more than one Democrat. To make a possessive noun out of a plural noun that ends in ‘s,’ add an apostrophe after the ‘s’: Democrats’.
